alert.note: Alert for Lower Iberia; Lower St. Mary; Lower Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 11:05PM CST until January 09 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in south central Louisiana, Lafayette, Lower Iberia, Lower St. Martin, Lower St. Mary, Upper Iberia, Upper St. Martin and Upper St. Mary. In southwest Louisiana, Lower Vermilion and Upper Vermilion. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Training showers and thunderstorms are ongoing across Acadiana Parishes in south-central Louisiana. Rainfall totals 0.50 to 1.00 inches have been noted by area observations which is expected to continue through the next few hours. Flash flooding conditions may be exacerbated by antecedent moisture from previous storm systems and rainfall already received today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Iberia; Lower St. Mary; Lower Vermilion
